This fixes the first issue for me:

~~~
diff -r 14b400a699f9 src/systems/log/LogPlayback.cc
--- a/src/systems/log/LogPlayback.cc    Tue Oct 22 13:49:56 2019 -0400
+++ b/src/systems/log/LogPlayback.cc    Mon Nov 25 17:10:53 2019 -0800
@@ -393,7 +393,7 @@
     }
 
     // Prepend log path to file path
-    std::string pathPrepended = filePrefix + common::joinPaths(this->logPath,
+    std::string pathPrepended = common::joinPaths(this->logPath,
       pathNoPrefix);
 
     // For backward compatibility. If prepended record path does not exist,
~~~

It looks like `common::exists` doesn't support paths starting with `file://`, so it thinks that the prepended path doesn't exist and tries to look at the original location.

It looks like `file://` was added on purpose though - do you think it's ok to remove it, @{mabelmzhang} ?
